Description: Fragment of floor of East Greek wheel-made pottery lamp; raised nipple at centre of floor; interior: nipple glazed; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: This type of wheel-made lamp was produced during the end of the 6th and 5th centuries BC in Greece (Bailey 1975, Q13-16, Q46-58), though this is just a small fragment of this type. The fabric may be East Greek or Greek.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.21) (Phase 1)
